intro: Polygala nicaeensis subsp. forojulensis, commonly known as the Forojulian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as cliffs and coastal areas. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is known for its distinctive, often spiny leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
